description: System-generated unique identifier for the contact status record, serving as the primary key and for foreign-key references.
Label or code representing the contact’s lifecycle state; shown in user interfaces and stored on related records.
Long-form explanation of the status’s meaning, scope, and intended use.
Boolean flag indicating this status is assigned by default when a new contact is created.
Internal code that drives behavior/workflow for this status (eligibility, transitions, visibility). Value mapping is system-specific; confirm with SME.
Boolean flag to exclude this status from selection lists and lookup searches.
Boolean flag to exclude this status from reports, dashboards, and analytics.
Soft-delete indicator; when set, the status is no longer selectable or used operationally.
Free-text notes providing context or guidance about the status.
System timestamp of the most recent change to this record, used for auditing and synchronization.
Likely timestamp of the most recent user-initiated change; column name suggests a user reference but stores datetime; confirm with SME.
Identifier of the user who initially created this record.
Timestamp when this record was initially created.
Identifier of the user who most recently updated this record.
Timestamp of the most recent update performed by a user.
